title: Allow bootstrap to use custom test runner commands

labels.name: A-testsuite
labels.description: Area: The testsuite used to check the correctness of rustc

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: T-bootstrap
labels.description: Relevant to the bootstrap subteam: Rust's build system (x.py and src/bootstrap)

labels.name: A-contributor-roadblock
labels.description: Area: Makes things more difficult for new contributors to rust itself

body:
Currently it's quite involved to run `x.py test` for a target other than the host - often you're forced to use the [remote-test-server](https://rustc-dev-guide.rust-lang.org/tests/running.html#running-tests-on-a-remote-machine) running in the specified environment. This is sometimes required to bless platform-specific UI tests.

This workflow could be made easier for contributors with a feature similar to [cargo's runner option](https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/config.html#targettriplerunner) which runs executables with the specified command. For example, in order to execute aarch64-only tests, the workflow for `x86-unknown-linux-gnu` developers could simply be:

- Install qemu and a cross-compilation system package
- Set this option to `qemu-aarch64 -L /usr/aarch64-linux-gnu` (or another libc location)
- Run `x.py test --target aarch64-unknown-linux-gnu`

More discussion [here](https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/131828-t-compiler/topic/single.20target.20tests.20and.20contributing.20from.20M1)
